intro: Baeckea diosmoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf baeckea, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Baeckea diosmoides is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
